result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Anthony Nakazono

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by PD's office, appointing Atty Satorius. bph
Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 10/7/22. kma

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Christany C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device with restriction of 1/2 mile from Christany C.'s residence. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:37 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for DE. Defendant Charles Anthony Nakazono in court, in custody by video. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. Bond arguments. Court sets bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:44 PM. kma
Settlement conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference on November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
